replies.body:
This likely would have only been a chat restriction, but the punishment was escalated since you have obtained so many punishments in a short period of time without showing any signs of improving your behavior.

The escalation schedule is as follows:
10-game chat restriction
25-game chat restriction
14-day ban
Perma ban

In your case it really wasn't about the outright severity of these chat logs, but persistently creating a poor experience for others with your behavior.

I hope this helps explain why this chat lead to a perma ban.

Honestly, the escalation system is dumb. most of the comments on this chatlog are directed at the game and match making system. Yes there are comments directed at individuals, but even from this log its clearly evident that the team was wholly toxic. If the game is going to implement escalating punishments it needs to take into account the game in whole and be able to analysis the root cause of that games toxicity and punish according to that. If this individual was being moderately toxic and his team escalated that, the other members of the team need to be dealt with accordingly. issuing permanent bans for very mild toxic actions does not solve the problem. it only allows those instigators to continue escalating scenarios.

Except, let's be honest, they don't. I've gotten a chat restriction on an account I hadn't been on in a month, when I argued it, I was given standard Rolodex reply: Well, we gave it, you earned it.

The amount of time you were not on that account really doesn't mean anything.  Chat restrictions will wait for you no matter how long you're away from your account.

Now, if you are trying to say you did not earn the restriction before you took a break from that account I would ask for chat logs, because that's really the only form of evidence you can have.

I did. 
And they told me that "I had been given the chat restriction for poor behavior." I messaged them back, telling them I hadn't even been on, and I got the EXACT SAME MESSAGE.
So I brought it to the forums, where it was quickly down voted and ignored. 
I wonder why i only play customs now

I think you missed what I said...

The behavior was BEFORE you stopped using the account.  You didn't get punished while inactive, you were punished before you went inactive, and didn't notice.

And you missed what I said.
No it wasn't.
My account was clear when I stopped, the last four or so games I played having been customs, full groups with my friends, followed by a bot game to dick around with. 

I was clear when I left, and I checked my match history, and sure enough, no extra matches were on there.

You can't be punished while you're inactive.  That's simply not how it works.

If I were in your shoes I would not have left it at a second reply from Riot.  I would keep messaging them (while waiting for a reply message, so that I don't spam) until my problem was resolved.  To simply give up like you did is a completely foreign idea I can't wrap my head around.

If something messes up like that don't just resign yourself to your fate.  Go make another support ticket, or attempt to reopen the old one, and get that thing taken off your record.

Riot makes a fun game, but they've lost my support, and that's not even going into the parent companies disgusting ass politics. i may try again when and if Riot releases their robotic stranglehold, and re-issues the tribunal, but I've simply decided it's not worth it.

A) Idocracy was right, and stupid people who have no business (and never intend on) being parents are out breeding good parents.
